page.title: 06QUARRIES
page.content: The quarries served the past and in a different way are serving the present. The presence of vast amounts of natural stone made it both easy and obvious to use the {DRY STONE WALL } technique to divide pastures and mark boundaries.Throughout this century the skill and the walls have fallen into disrepair and with it the necessity to quarry. The quarries lay idle and because of their geography hidden from view. Rapid obsolescence of industrial machines has vastly increased the waste material that is neither biodegradable nor burnable.The disused quarries of this area are serving well the needs of the eighties by providing ideal locations to dispose of this waste. It is fitting and hopeful for the future that one age can restore and repair the environment changed by the differing needs of the past.
